data.title: Top Local Stories
data.meta_description: Local breaking news, with live updates on traffic and weather. National, business, real estate, lifestyle and politics. CityNews, Everywhere.
data.text:
Metallica is kicking off the first of two shows this weekend at Commonwealth Stadium and fans are already lined up in the afternoon to get in as heavy metal is taking over the city. “Been waiting for…

The road to recovery is starting to clear for businesses in Jasper, Alta., a month after some 25,000 visitors and residents were forced to flee a raging wildfire. While Jasper National Park and the…

More than 1,700 K-6 teachers in Alberta will pilot the draft social studies curriculum this fall, years after changes to programming were first proposed by the United Conservative Party.

Edmonton police say a woman is in hospital following a collision Friday morning in Mill Woods. EPS responded to Millwoods Road and 23 Avenue around 11 a.m., after receiving a report of a serious collision. According…

Allison Lang is an Edmonton-born and raised athlete who’s currently in France to compete for Team Canada in sitting volleyball at the Paralympics. Lang was born missing the lower half of her left leg. “I…

Police in Edmonton are warning drivers that a Metallica concert at Commonwealth Stadium will cause significant traffic congestion. They say officers will be controlling vehicle and pedestrian…

The Teamsters say they intend to fight the Labour Minister’s call for binding arbitration to end the national rail stoppage. The NDP say arbitration stops companies and unions from freely bargaining a deal.

Kamala Harris has officially accepted the Democratic Presidential nomination. Brian Abel with how Donald Trump is taking aim at Harris as the race for the White House shifts into a new phase.

Interest rate cuts are expected soon on both sides of the border. Plus, Air Canada pilots are stepping up the pressure ahead of a potential strike. Kris McCusker has the day’s top business stories.

Edmonton students will go back to school in just one week and one organization provides backpacks for children in need of school supplies. Our Leo Cruzat has more with the donation and a bus event for first riders.

A city councillor wants Edmonton to stop approving major infrastructure projects until major changes are made to improve the process. As Sean Amato, the announcement may mark an unofficial start to the next mayoral campaign. #yegcc #yegtraffic #yeg

Rail workers pushed back hard Friday against the federal government’s move to get them back on the job, with a new strike notice and a regulatory challenge making it unclear when freight traffic will fully…

The criminal trial of “Freedom Convoy” organizers Tamara Lich and Chris Barber is expected to enter its sixth day of closing arguments. The two are co-accused of mischief, intimidation, and counselling…

Retail sales dropped in June as Canadians continued to grapple with high interest rates. Statistics Canada said Friday that retail sales fell 0.3 per cent to $65.7 billion that month, led by a drop…

In today’s The Big Story podcast, are you tired? In pain? Gaining weight? Experiencing any unusual symptoms? Welcome to what seems to be this summer’s newest TikTok diagnosis from the wellness industry. On…

Canada’s two biggest railways are preparing to get trains running again after Ottawa said it would step in to end a bitter labour dispute. Canadian National Railway Co. says it has ended its lockout…

The union representing thousands of Air Canada pilots have voted to authorize a strike for next month. On Thursday, the Air Line Pilots Association (ALPA) announced that 98 per cent of its members voted…

Early Thursday morning, firefighters were called to a house fire in north Edmonton. According to fire officials, the call came in at 5:15 a.m. and crews were on scene at the house on St. Albert Trail…

The RCMP says a man has died in a plane crash in eastern Alberta near the Saskatchewan boundary. Mounties in Kitscoty were notified of the crash shortly after takeoff. Officers and first…

Imperial Oil has been fined $50,000 after the province’s energy regulator concluded the company broke environmental laws when wastewater containing oilsands tailings seeped outside its lease boundary in…

The group representing Alberta’s rural municipalities says the province is trying to increase production from its declining conventional oil and gas fields at the expense of local tax bases, environmental oversight and the public interest.

Economists say the work stoppage that began overnight at Canada’s two major railways will have a significant effect on the country’s economy. Canadian National Railway Co. and Canadian Pacific Kansas…

A new poll suggests more Canadians are feeling the direct impacts of extreme weather, but that has not changed overall opinions about climate change. The results from a recent Leger poll suggest more…

TD Bank Group reported a loss of $181 million in its latest quarter as it was hit by a charge related to ongoing U.S. investigations into its anti-money laundering program. The big bank said Thursday…

The World Health Organization (WHO) has declared an outbreak of Mpox in Africa a “global health emergency.” But in a time where outbreaks of diseases are continually met with scary headlines, and many…

Ukraine ratified the Rome Statute of the International Criminal Court, taking a step toward membership and opening the possibility of more prosecutions of Russian officials for war crimes. Ukraine’s…

The Italian coast guard said Thursday the body of British tech magnate Mike Lynch is among those recovered off the coast of Sicily from the wreckage of a superyacht whose builders had called unsinkable. One…

The Edmonton Police Service says they’ve received multiple reports from synagogues saying they’ve received threats. Investigators believe this is linked to a nationwide series of threats that have targeted…

The Edmonton Valley Zoo has euthanized one of its tigers, Taiga, after her health began to “rapidly decline.” Taiga was a 16-year-old tiger brought to the Edmonton Valley Zoo from northern Ontario as…
